properties.name: Ah Tee Ko Ko Mee
properties.description:
Address:
#01-100 Gourmet Street, Blk 27 Kelantan Court, 200027

Opening Hours:
Mon-Sat, 5.30am-1.30pm

Shop Recommendations:
Teochew Fishball Noodle

Other Details:
Sim Ah Tee, 73, is a hawker for over 50 years Being unable to read or write, Ah Tee was at a disadvantage when the Covid-19 Circuit Breaker started last year. While eateries and hawkers scrambled to offer food delivery, Ah Tee could not keep up with the new technology. “At the age of 70 plus, he’s not agile enough to multitask anymore. He’s still using the old Nokia handphone,” his son Calvin Sim, 49, tells 8days.sg. It doesn’t help that Ah Tee (pictured above) also faces competition from the bigger, more well-known Berseh Food Centre nearby. Despite the slow business, he has continued to open his stall as usual. “He’s a committed person. He’s making a loss every day, but insisted on carrying on till now despite using his own savings [to sustain]. As I’m working, I can’t manage his calls for him,” says Calvin, who tried to help his dad drum up business by posting about the stall on Facebook foodie groups like Can Eat! Hawker Food.

Contributor:
8 Days

properties.name: 85 乡村古早蚝煎
properties.description:
Address:
#01-05, 85 Fengshan Centre, Blk 85 Bedok North St 4, 460085

Opening Hours:
daily 11.30am-11pm.

Shop Recommendations:
Carrot cake

Other Details:
Like Ah Tee, hawker Goh Peng Huan, 61, struggles with dismal numbers. Together with his partner Anne Tan, 59, he runs the 85 乡村古早蚝煎 stall at Fengshan Centre in Bedok selling fried oyster omelette, carrot cake, bak chor mee and handmade ngoh hiang till 11pm daily. From February to June last year, they had zero income as their hawker centre was undergoing renovations, which were delayed by the pandemic. When Phase 2 (HA) kicked in on May 14, 2021, there was immediately a “drastic drop” in business. Speaking to 8days.sg, Peng Huan’s daughter Desrina Goh, 39, says: “There was a 60 per cent drop in customers. Today was the worst yet, not even 30 per cent of the usual number of customers.” Delivery is also out of the question for Peng Huan. “My dad is illiterate, so it’s very difficult for him to work with a digital delivery platform. WhatsApp orders are not possible as well, because he can’t read,” Desrina frets.

Contributor:
8 Days

properties.name: Yong Tau Foo (酿豆腐)
properties.description:
Address:
Blk 89 Circuit Road, #01-95 370089

Opening Hours:
daily 6am-2pm

Shop Recommendations:


Other Details:
Helping a friend who is badly affected by the Phase 2 Heightened Alert. They are neither on delivery platforms nor knows about Hawkers united until recently. This unassuming couple are up 3am every day, preparing fresh Yong Tau Foo for sale. They serve yummy versions such as the Dry (sweet sauce), Soupy and Laksa. Look at the variety and you know it is a hit with the elderly – who loves items such as brinjal, lady-finger, yam, pork belly, intestines and so forth. Their Laksa is very very old-school-authentic, too! Serene insisted to serve value for money Yong Tau Foo in the Macpherson community for the past 7 years. She refused to raise price even as supplies do get more expensive over the years. Always courteous, Steven serves his wok-hei Char Kway Teow at the back of the stall as supplement as the elderly loves it. The one and only Yong Tau Foo stall in this market. Pls support if you are in the area! P/S: Serene’s parents used to own this famous Yong Tau Foo stall in Kallang Airport for the past 30 years – 40 years and they decided to retire and pass down the family recipe!

Contributor:
Stanley Tay

A humble stall serving up the most delicious fishball or mushroom minced meat noodles from just $3 in the heart of Clementi. The mushroom and meatballs are fresh and juicy, and go well with the noodles which sit in a bit of gravy – just the way I feel it should be. Stall is owned by a couple who’ve been running this stall for decades now. Had a chat with the owners recently and they mentioned that business is awfully bad during this period, particularly dinner time. Sadly, they’re also not on any food delivery platforms. Hence, I told them I’d do my best to help spread the word on social media. A very tasty meal at an affordable price. Order a bigger portion if you prefer.

Other Details:
Please support this pair of brothers who operate a roast meat and kway chap stall in the kopitiam located at 118 Hougang Ave 1, Singapore 530118. Their roasted meats are tasty and sio bak is delightfully crispy. I have been a long time patron of this stall and found their kway chap to be well prepared with generous portions. The brothers are quite senior and does not have any online ordering. They are completely reliant on take away orders. Unfortunately, as with all hawkers, they are struggling and shared that they are currently operating at a loss. Every packet counts and your gesture goes a long way. So if you are in the area, please visit this stall. Thank you.

properties.description:
Address:
531A Upper Cross Street #01-52 Hong Lim Complex 051531

Opening Hours:
10am – 3pm

Shop Recommendations:
Herbal claypot soups

Other Details:
Uncle Chua believes in there’s no replacement for cooking herbal soups in a claypot over a charcoal fire, and he’s one of the few hawkers who still does diligently everyday. He starts preparations at 5am to make sure the herbs and ingredients have enough time on the stove, bringing a nostalgic, home-cooked quality to the nourishing soups. Though he gets less customers these days, he still puts his heart into cooking and making sure the flavours are still the same.

properties.name: Golden Mile Teochew Fishball Noodle
properties.description:
Address:
505 Beach Road, Golden Mile Food Centre #B1-47 199583

Opening Hours:


Shop Recommendations:
Meepok Dry

Other Details:
This humble store specialises in traditional Teochew style fishball noodle and has been at Golden Mile for decades. I love that they serve a little of everything and offers food variety of ingredients including prawn, fish ball, pork ball, fish cake, sliced pork and even char siew which diffentiate themself from the typical fishball noodles. Texture of the meepok dry is good and the sauce is just nice and taste heavenly when mixed together. No alkaline taste and noodles remained springy even after dabao all the way to Pasir Ris. Do offer your support to this hawker which is currently not on any delivery platform nor social media. If you are looking for a good bowl of noodles, do give it a try. So satisfying!

Javier Lim

properties.name: 肥阿嬷迷你锅  (Fat Ah Ma Mini Pot)
properties.description:
Address:
Golden Mile Food centre 505 Beach Rd #01-89 199583

Opening Hours:
10:30am – 7:30pm

Shop Recommendations:
Sesame Oil Chicken

Other Details:
My original intent this evening was to sample a pasta meal from Chef Choo Signature (Stall B1-45) but I arrived too late, just as they were closing. As I walked around to look for an alternative option, Uncle & Auntie eating their dinner outside their quiet stall looked up expectantly at me. I took a quick glance and two items immediately caught my eye - 卤猪脚Braised Pig Trotters and 麻油鸡 Sesame Oil Chicken. Uncle happily obliged my sinful request for fattier parts of the pig trotters and also gave me a good-sized serving of chicken. Auntie tempted me with a spoonful of her special 家乡猪肚汤 Pig Stomach Soup which was peppery, the way I like it. I will definitely return to try that and also the 肉骨茶 Bak Kut Teh / Pork Rib Soup & 干炒老鼠粉Stir Fried Mee Tai Mak �� As I was leaving, the couple expressed their heartfelt gratitude for my patronage. It wasn’t much but I guess it meant a lot to them ��

Contributor:
Marcus Khoo

properties.name: Da Jia Shi
properties.description:
Address:
Chinatown Food Complex 335 Smith St, #02-147

Opening Hours:
6am to 2pm

Shop Recommendations:
Cantonese style congee. several options available. deep friend intestines (signature item). fried beehoon/noodles

Other Details:
My grandma and recently, my mom too, has been running this Cantonese style congee stall in Chinatown Food Complex since 1960. Since then, they have been relying on weekend regular customers and the lunch crowd from the CBD areas however with COVID-19 and especially the work from home arrangement coupled with the no dining in restrictions, the business have been heavily impacted, like with most stalls there. Given the location, there are not many residential places within the area unlike the heartlands hence delivery platforms aren't a viable alternative. They are just a humble congee stall that just wants to provide comfort food for everyone and would be great to get some support during these tough times!

Contributor:
timotheosh

They have been in Tiong Bahru market since before I was born (the stall has been there for more than half a century, from one-level wet market to the current building, both the stall and recipe are passed down from through generations and the stall will end with my parents' retirement unfortunately. My parents are elderly in their early 70s and I am currently not in Singapore to help them out. They can barely read English nor use smartphones efficiently and the stall is not registered on popular food delivery platforms. My parents are able to take bulk order via their phone 9650 4614, however please be understanding if they are unable to pick up the phone as it is only the 2 of them and they may be serving customers. THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR THE SUPPORT AND WARMTH!!

Contributor:
Gwendolyn Choo-Keffer

Address:
335 Smith St, #02-184, Singapore 050335 050335

Opening Hours:


Shop Recommendations:
Their porridge is smooth and "gup". Very home cooked, comfort food that you would expect from your grandma. Good for something flavourful yet light. If you want meat, order their pork porridge that comes with juicy meatballs. Don't forget to add an egg and spring onions!

Other Details:
Very old school Cantonese Porridge that has been operating in this hawker centre for many years. Hawkers are an elderly couple who do not have any delivery services and rely on old regulars and the working crowd to survive. With WFH they are struggling but still maintain a positive attitude. Uncle likes to joke in a mixture of Chinese and English.

properties.description:
Address:

Open 5.30am - 1030am Tues - Thu, Sat & Sun until 11.30am. Rest days Mon & Fri.

Shop Recommendations:
Coffee & Tea

Other Details:
Stall has been operating since the 1979s. 50 years of fragrant hand-brewed traditional coffee and tea from $0.80/cup – The owner insists on keeping prices low (they were planning to +$0.10/cup in June but Covid hit and he decided not to) due to the owner’s belief that “[they] have seen 3 generation of customers from grandfathers to their grandchildren, and keeping prices low is a way of repaying the favour to our loyal customers. As long as they like the coffee, [he will] continue to brew it”. True to his words, the price of their drinks have only risen by $0.20 over the past 12 years.

properties.name: Ah Seng (Hai Nam) Coffee
properties.description:
Address:
Amoy Street Food Centre #02-95 69111

Opening Hours:


Shop Recommendations:
Local drinks, kaya toast

Other Details:
This is one coffee stall I used to frequent on weekends and they enjoyed brisk business from CBD crowd or weekend cyclist in the past. But due to phase 2, their business is so bad. You might wonder, how bad can it be? I went at 11am to order 4 French toast, 2 Kaya toast,5 packets of kopi and teh and 2 soft boiled eggs for about $15. They told me I’m the 2nd or 3rd customer since 6am and others only bought one or two cups of kopi. Which means they only earned probably about $20 since 6am������ Their pricing is already relatively lower than other coffee stalls so it doesn’t make sense for them to be on any delivery platform. Please please don’t let our local coffee heritage die. That one cup of $8 latte you save today can be used here to save a local business. If you happen to be at the vicinty, please patronise this mother and son shop.

Contributor:
Cheryl Yap

Malay Dishes- Mee Rebus, Mee Soto, Mee Siam, Lontong, Nasi Lemak, Nasi Padang, etc.

My parents has been in the wedding industry for 15 years to raise me and my sisters up and for survival as they have little to no academic qualification. Covid striked and their business went down till we are currently selling our house to payback huge loans on deferment. Hence, they decided to open a stall, as their forte is cooking. properties.name: Malay stall
properties.description:
Address:
Blk 136 Potong Pasir Ave 1

Opening Hours:
6am to 2pm

Shop Recommendations:


Other Details:
Copied from FB post: Hi all, I'm a taxi driver. Everyday morning 4.15am, I will pick up a Malay aunty from teck whye to blk 136 potong pasir ave 1. This Malay aunty selling Malay foods at blk 136 potong pasir. She in her late 60s with walking difficulty . Walking with a walking stick. Due to this covid-19, her business is badly affected. She is old traditional style .Don trust food delivery like grabfood or foodpanda. I pick her up daily since 2018 till now. Due to covid19, her business hit badly. Sometime she have to owe my taxi fare accumulated near $100+. Knowing government giving subsidy for rental but the coffeeshop owner does not give them the rebate. Despite going to MP several time but still no action taken. She have a soft and kind heart. Always help those who she can help like, In potong pasir neighborhood, there a guy in his mid 40s with some mental issue, without failed, she will try to give him $2 and food few time almost everyday. Everyday during the journey, I will try to ask how her business the day before. Sometime she will say , business is quite bad till she can't pay her daily rental $50 etc. Her leftover food, she will try not to throw away. Sometime her balance kuey / curry puff she will ask someone to pass to the mosque. Sometime , she owe my taxi fare near $100+ , she will need to wait for her monthly CPF retirement fund to come in to pay me. Hope, people who nearby or staying at potong pasir will support her food. She sell Malay food like nasi lemak, mee Siam , Mee goreng , Mee rebus , Mee Soto and many more. Her location is at blk 136 potong pasir coffeeshop ( Just infront of carpark gantry) Her opening timing : 6am to 2pm Her stall is beside toilet and she have walking difficulty with walking stick. Normally she will be working alone. Just imagine , with her leg issue, she need to prepare food, cook food , serve customer all by herself. Hope everyone will support her. I never let her know that I will be posting this too. Just hoping I could help her Abit in her business too Please help to share this post too. Stay safe and fight against Covid-19.

properties.name: Moli Food Stall
properties.description:
Address:
16 Bedok South Road, #01-18 Singapore 460016

Opening Hours:


Shop Recommendations:
Vadai

Other Details:
Bedok Snack Stall Barely Gets Customers, Auntie Still Wakes Up Early To Make & Sell Vadais. I was walking around and observing that many stalks are doing brisk business (probably due to a wet and rainy Saturday) until I spotted this lone stall - there was no one in queue. I observed that maybe one or 2 folks would walk up to the stall, take a look and walk off. I do not know why. I decided to go up to the Aunty and strike up a conversation with her. Aunty is very soft spoken. She manage this stall on her own most times and sometimes with ad hoc help. She gets up early to prepare the ingredients. She / her stall is not on any delivery platform / FB. She told me her business is so bad that she hardly makes any money. If not for the one month rental rebate from G, she hardly makes any money after deducting all the ingredients and supplies etc. Her fear is understandable. So much so that she does not even dare to make more than 10 Vadai at a time for fear of them becoming too cold and hard which she is worried that it will make her lose her usual and maybe potential customers. I bought a few Vadai back to try and I must say at $0.60cents a piece, they are good. Soft and flavourful. I choose to support her which I really think she genuinely needed more support in letting people know her existence. As you are reading this, this is one such stall that you can seriously consider showing your support to her and by sharing this post. Not very expensive / difficult to begin with. What is genuinely needed here is more support, more sharing and awareness for her. Life is already very tough for her at the current situation and its getting more harder each day as she wonders how long she can keep going and sustain it.

Louis Tan

properties.name: Meng Fruits
properties.description:
Address:
Block 4A Jalan Batu Market & Hawker Centre #01-32 432004

Opening Hours:


Shop Recommendations:


Other Details:
I decided to venture into Jln Batu Hawker Centre. As I was walking around, I noticed this lone figure sitting quietly staring at his mobile phone inside his stall. In my 5 minutes of observation, I noticed maybe 15 folks walked past his stall. Not a single one of them approach his stall. I decided to walk up to his stall. When Uncle saw me approaching him, he eagerly stand up and asked what I would like to have. I can sense his urgency but when he said, I am his 1st customer of the day. My heart sank deeply at that moment. The time then was 1145am, politely I asked if his sales takings were affected by the recent prohibition of dining in. He gave out a loud sigh.. I can sense his helplessness then and there. Jokingly he said "人算不如天算" (unpredictable situation). "Its a very tough situation". He relies on regulars and walk in customers. Now that it is the by default mode to WFH, his regulars don't come that frequently anymore. And walk in customers who can't dine in, are not buying drinks from him that much. Also, Jln Batu Hawker Centre can be a bit ulu to some. Regardless of the situation, Uncle still maintain his positive outlook. With a sense of pride, he strongly recommended to me his 100% handmade agar agar jelly dessert. He said his agar agar is probably the cheapest or if not, one of the cheapest that one can ever locate in Singapore. At 0.50cents a piece of the agar agar jelly, they come in various flavours. Coffee, Yam, Rainbow, plain and few others - really Can Eat for me. This is the best part - Uncle refused to increase his price over the years. He said his customers included mostly senior citizens and those who are staying around the area are in 1, 2 and 3 rooms flat. Affordability is an issue to some of the folks there. Uncle said he could not bear to increase his pricing and would rather earn lesser or none at times. Even when he is struggling to stay afloat, he still has a compassion heart for others. For this, he has my utmost respect. What surprises me was that Uncle is also selling his agar agar jelly in a big square plastic container box at only $4 - see picture. I got 3 boxes of Yam agar agar jelly without hesitation. Uncle was very appreciative and hope that I will come back soon to try his yakult fruit juices. He is also selling slice cut fruits too. Folks, this is one genuine Hawker whose business is greatly affected by the present situation. He has a big heart and filled with compassion. He deserve all your support, so please go down to support him and share this post for greater awareness. Whether its a slice of cut fruit or a piece of agar agar jelly at 0.50 cents or a cup of fruit juice, it matters alot to him.

Contributor:
Louis Tan
